para: Floating boundary conditions set the values of &fields; on a boundary, up to an unspecified offset. &field; values on the boundary can change, but &field; differences between two points on the boundary will stay fixed. A separate boundary condition must be established for each component of a &field; that is to be constrained. Floating boundary conditions may be applied to both Edge and Point boundaries.
The parameters for floating boundary conditions are the same as those for Dirichlet boundary conditions. See that discussion for details.
